Chiricahua Apache Text 9. The Sun as told by Lawrence Mithlo "Inside of the Sun, two cottonwood trees stand erect." (9.1) "Jígonaa'áé bigheeshíͅ, t'iis naaki 'óó'á." 'iłk'idáne daa n dígo yaadaagooł n dí. "Inside of the Sun, two cottonwood trees stand erect." say the old people [when] they tell about it. Linguistic Notes by Harry Hoijer (9.1) Linguistic Notes 1. jígonaa'áí [also heard jíͅgonaa'áí 'the sun'. Possibly a compound of jíͅgo 'being day, during the day' [cf. jíͅíͅ' 'day'], naa'á 'a round object moves about' [3rd person cont. imp. with prefix naa- 'about' of -'aa 'a round object moves'] and - í relative. 2. 'iłk'idáͅne 'the old people'. 'iłk'idáͅ 'long ago' [part.] plus -ne 'people of such and such a group'.
